Quickstride and Uproar cautiously follow Leo ll  as they sniff the air, and=
 move their ears in all directions.  Usually quite light hearted, Quickstri=
de appears a bit nervous as does his friend, who's fur ripples with anxiety=
.  He could sense a trap in the making.  His tail hangs low, while body lan=
guage suggests " I know something is wrong, just a matter of time before it=
 shows it's ugly head" kind of pose.  Quickstride snorts.

" Something tell=
s me our problems aren't quite over with.. Maybe we should get inta robot m=
ode for this."

Uproar nodds.

"Yeah, well, us anyway, because we're not tr=
ansmetal.  We're far better off in robot mode, effective wise.  That's wher=
e we can acess our weaponry."

They get into robot mode, as Quickstride hol=
ds a large cannon over one of his shoulders, while Uproar draws a katanna f=
rom a scabbard behind his right shoulder.

"Ninjas huh?  I think I can get =
around Ninjas if I have to."

Quickstride looks to him.

"Don't get cocky, =
Uproar.  Something tells me this is someone we haven't got a clue as ta how=
 ta deal with 'em."

On the way back to the ark, Tucson desperately tries t=
o access the power to at least drive himself back to base, yet, finds that =
his engine will not restart.

" Hmm?  Have - no battery power."

Rat Trap n=
odds.

" I bet Lizard Lips severed one of the wires that connects ta your b=
attery.  Lemme check."

He scampers to the engine, via the glove compartmen=
t, and finds the trouble.

"I was right, kind of.  Your wiring's totally fr=
ied big guy.  Ouch a rama...  Battery's okay, alternator's good..  Woahh, h=
ello, severed fuel line spotted.  Must've missed that one when I patched up=
 that last battery fluid line.  No wonder, you're outa fuel and ya got no p=
ower gon' ta the battery."

Tucson sighs.

" I have to be more careful."

R=
at Trap returns to the cab as he gives his large friend that "I told you so=
" kind of expression.

"Yeah, well, that's what we've been tryn' ta tell ya=
 Wheels.  From now on, you're gonna listen ta us right?"

Tucson replies wi=
th a slight groan.

"Of course."

He now turns his com link on to Rodimus.
=

"Rodimus, this is Tucson, I need to know the status of the situation at th=
e Ark, over."

Night Shift continues to towe along with Bantor and the othe=
rs.

"Hey, don't even think of playn' hero again Tucson!  You're not in the=
 best of condition!  Can't even start your engine let alone gon' inta activ=
e duty.  Hey, Talon, make sure he doesn't try anythn' risky. Knowing him, i=
f he can walk, he'll attempt it."

ntor nodded at the request for him to hook back up to Tuscon. He did not
